29#ifndef _DRM_MODE_H
30#define _DRM_MODE_H
31
32#include <linux/types.h>
33
34#define DRM_DISPLAY_INFO_LEN 32
35#define DRM_CONNECTOR_NAME_LEN 32
36#define DRM_DISPLAY_MODE_LEN 32
37#define DRM_PROP_NAME_LEN 32
38
39#define DRM_MODE_TYPE_BUILTIN (1<<0)
40#define DRM_MODE_TYPE_CLOCK_C ((1<<1) | DRM_MODE_TYPE_BUILTIN)
41#define DRM_MODE_TYPE_CRTC_C ((1<<2) | DRM_MODE_TYPE_BUILTIN)
42#define DRM_MODE_TYPE_PREFERRED (1<<3)
43#define DRM_MODE_TYPE_DEFAULT (1<<4)
44#define DRM_MODE_TYPE_USERDEF (1<<5)
45#define DRM_MODE_TYPE_DRIVER (1<<6)
46
47/* Video mode flags */
48/* bit compatible with the xorg definitions. */
49#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_PHSYNC (1<<0)
50#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_NHSYNC (1<<1)
51#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_PVSYNC (1<<2)
52#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_NVSYNC (1<<3)
53#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_INTERLACE (1<<4)
54#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLSCAN (1<<5)
55#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_CSYNC (1<<6)
56#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_PCSYNC (1<<7)
57#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_NCSYNC (1<<8)
58#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_HSKEW (1<<9) /* hskew provided */
59#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_BCAST (1<<10)
60#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_PIXMUX (1<<11)
61#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLCLK (1<<12)
62#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_CLKDIV2 (1<<13)
63 /*
64 * When adding a new stereo mode don't forget to adjust DRM_MODE_FLAGS_3D_MAX
65 * (define not exposed to user space).
66 */
67#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_MASK (0x1f<<14)
68#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_NONE (0<<14)
69#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_FRAME_PACKING (1<<14)
70#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_FIELD_ALTERNATIVE (2<<14)
71#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_LINE_ALTERNATIVE (3<<14)
72#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_SIDE_BY_SIDE_FULL (4<<14)
73#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_L_DEPTH (5<<14)
74#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_L_DEPTH_GFX_GFX_DEPTH (6<<14)
75#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_TOP_AND_BOTTOM (7<<14)
76#define DRM_MODE_FLAG_3D_SIDE_BY_SIDE_HALF (8<<14)
77
78
79/* DPMS flags */
80/* bit compatible with the xorg definitions. */
81#define DRM_MODE_DPMS_ON 0
82#define DRM_MODE_DPMS_STANDBY 1
83#define DRM_MODE_DPMS_SUSPEND 2
84#define DRM_MODE_DPMS_OFF 3
85
86/* Scaling mode options */
87#define DRM_MODE_SCALE_NONE 0 /* Unmodified timing (display or
88 software can still scale) */
89#define DRM_MODE_SCALE_FULLSCREEN 1 /* Full screen, ignore aspect */
90#define DRM_MODE_SCALE_CENTER 2 /* Centered, no scaling */
91#define DRM_MODE_SCALE_ASPECT 3 /* Full screen, preserve aspect */
92
93/* Picture aspect ratio options */
94#define DRM_MODE_PICTURE_ASPECT_NONE 0
95#define DRM_MODE_PICTURE_ASPECT_4_3 1
96#define DRM_MODE_PICTURE_ASPECT_16_9 2
97
98/* Dithering mode options */
99#define DRM_MODE_DITHERING_OFF 0
100#define DRM_MODE_DITHERING_ON 1
101#define DRM_MODE_DITHERING_AUTO 2
102
103/* Dirty info options */
104#define DRM_MODE_DIRTY_OFF 0
105#define DRM_MODE_DIRTY_ON 1
106#define DRM_MODE_DIRTY_ANNOTATE 2
107
108struct drm_mode_modeinfo {
109 __u32 clock;
110 __u16 hdisplay;
111 __u16 hsync_start;
112 __u16 hsync_end;
113 __u16 htotal;
114 __u16 hskew;
115 __u16 vdisplay;
116 __u16 vsync_start;
117 __u16 vsync_end;
118 __u16 vtotal;
119 __u16 vscan;
120
121 __u32 vrefresh;
122
123 __u32 flags;
124 __u32 type;
125 char name[DRM_DISPLAY_MODE_LEN];
126};
127
128struct drm_mode_card_res {
129 __u64 fb_id_ptr;
130 __u64 crtc_id_ptr;
131 __u64 connector_id_ptr;
132 __u64 encoder_id_ptr;
133 __u32 count_fbs;
134 __u32 count_crtcs;
135 __u32 count_connectors;
136 __u32 count_encoders;
137 __u32 min_width;
138 __u32 max_width;
139 __u32 min_height;
140 __u32 max_height;
141};
142
143struct drm_mode_crtc {
144 __u64 set_connectors_ptr;
145 __u32 count_connectors;
146
147 __u32 crtc_id; /**< Id */
148 __u32 fb_id; /**< Id of framebuffer */
149
150 __u32 x; /**< x Position on the framebuffer */
151 __u32 y; /**< y Position on the framebuffer */
152
153 __u32 gamma_size;
154 __u32 mode_valid;
155 struct drm_mode_modeinfo mode;
156};
157
158#define DRM_MODE_PRESENT_TOP_FIELD (1<<0)
159#define DRM_MODE_PRESENT_BOTTOM_FIELD (1<<1)
160
161/* Planes blend with or override other bits on the CRTC */
162struct drm_mode_set_plane {
163 __u32 plane_id;
164 __u32 crtc_id;
165 __u32 fb_id; /* fb object contains surface format type */
166 __u32 flags; /* see above flags */
167
168 /* Signed dest location allows it to be partially off screen */
169 __s32 crtc_x;
170 __s32 crtc_y;
171 __u32 crtc_w;
172 __u32 crtc_h;
173
174 /* Source values are 16.16 fixed point */
175 __u32 src_x;
176 __u32 src_y;
177 __u32 src_h;
178 __u32 src_w;
179};
180
181struct drm_mode_get_plane {
182 __u32 plane_id;
183
184 __u32 crtc_id;
185 __u32 fb_id;
186
187 __u32 possible_crtcs;
188 __u32 gamma_size;
189
190 __u32 count_format_types;
191 __u64 format_type_ptr;
192};
193
194struct drm_mode_get_plane_res {
195 __u64 plane_id_ptr;
196 __u32 count_planes;
197};
198
199#define DRM_MODE_ENCODER_NONE 0
200#define DRM_MODE_ENCODER_DAC 1
201#define DRM_MODE_ENCODER_TMDS 2
202#define DRM_MODE_ENCODER_LVDS 3
203#define DRM_MODE_ENCODER_TVDAC 4
204#define DRM_MODE_ENCODER_VIRTUAL 5
205#define DRM_MODE_ENCODER_DSI 6
206#define DRM_MODE_ENCODER_DPMST 7
207
208struct drm_mode_get_encoder {
209 __u32 encoder_id;
210 __u32 encoder_type;
211
212 __u32 crtc_id; /**< Id of crtc */
213
214 __u32 possible_crtcs;
215 __u32 possible_clones;
216};
217
218/* This is for connectors with multiple signal types. */
219/* Try to match DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_X as closely as possible. */
220#define DRM_MODE_SUBCONNECTOR_Automatic 0
221#define DRM_MODE_SUBCONNECTOR_Unknown 0
222#define DRM_MODE_SUBCONNECTOR_DVID 3
223#define DRM_MODE_SUBCONNECTOR_DVIA 4
224#define DRM_MODE_SUBCONNECTOR_Composite 5
225#define DRM_MODE_SUBCONNECTOR_SVIDEO 6
226#define DRM_MODE_SUBCONNECTOR_Component 8
227#define DRM_MODE_SUBCONNECTOR_SCART 9
228
229#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Unknown 0
230#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_VGA 1
231#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVII 2
232#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVID 3
233#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVIA 4
234#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Composite 5
235#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_SVIDEO 6
236#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_LVDS 7
237#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Component 8
238#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_9PinDIN 9
239#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DisplayPort 10
240#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_HDMIA 11
241#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_HDMIB 12
242#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_TV 13
243#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_eDP 14
244#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_VIRTUAL 15
245#define DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DSI 16
246
247struct drm_mode_get_connector {
248
249 __u64 encoders_ptr;
250 __u64 modes_ptr;
251 __u64 props_ptr;
252 __u64 prop_values_ptr;
253
254 __u32 count_modes;
255 __u32 count_props;
256 __u32 count_encoders;
257
258 __u32 encoder_id; /**< Current Encoder */
259 __u32 connector_id; /**< Id */
260 __u32 connector_type;
261 __u32 connector_type_id;
262
263 __u32 connection;
264 __u32 mm_width; /**< width in millimeters */
265 __u32 mm_height; /**< height in millimeters */
266 __u32 subpixel;
267
268 __u32 pad;
269};
270
271#define DRM_MODE_PROP_PENDING (1<<0)
272#define DRM_MODE_PROP_RANGE (1<<1)
273#define DRM_MODE_PROP_IMMUTABLE (1<<2)
274#define DRM_MODE_PROP_ENUM (1<<3) /* enumerated type with text strings */
275#define DRM_MODE_PROP_BLOB (1<<4)
276#define DRM_MODE_PROP_BITMASK (1<<5) /* bitmask of enumerated types */
277
278/* non-extended types: legacy bitmask, one bit per type: */
279#define DRM_MODE_PROP_LEGACY_TYPE ( \
280 DRM_MODE_PROP_RANGE | \
281 DRM_MODE_PROP_ENUM | \
282 DRM_MODE_PROP_BLOB | \
283 DRM_MODE_PROP_BITMASK)
284
285/* extended-types: rather than continue to consume a bit per type,
286 * grab a chunk of the bits to use as integer type id.
287 */
288#define DRM_MODE_PROP_EXTENDED_TYPE 0x0000ffc0
289#define DRM_MODE_PROP_TYPE(n) ((n) << 6)
290#define DRM_MODE_PROP_OBJECT DRM_MODE_PROP_TYPE(1)
291#define DRM_MODE_PROP_SIGNED_RANGE DRM_MODE_PROP_TYPE(2)
292
293/* the PROP_ATOMIC flag is used to hide properties from userspace that
294 * is not aware of atomic properties. This is mostly to work around
295 * older userspace (DDX drivers) that read/write each prop they find,
296 * witout being aware that this could be triggering a lengthy modeset.
297 */
298#define DRM_MODE_PROP_ATOMIC 0x80000000
299
300struct drm_mode_property_enum {
301 __u64 value;
302 char name[DRM_PROP_NAME_LEN];
303};
304
305struct drm_mode_get_property {
306 __u64 values_ptr; /* values and blob lengths */
307 __u64 enum_blob_ptr; /* enum and blob id ptrs */
308
309 __u32 prop_id;
310 __u32 flags;
311 char name[DRM_PROP_NAME_LEN];
312
313 __u32 count_values;
314 /* This is only used to count enum values, not blobs. The _blobs is
315 * simply because of a historical reason, i.e. backwards compat. */
316 __u32 count_enum_blobs;
317};
318
319struct drm_mode_connector_set_property {
320 __u64 value;
321 __u32 prop_id;
322 __u32 connector_id;
323};
324
325struct drm_mode_obj_get_properties {
326 __u64 props_ptr;
327 __u64 prop_values_ptr;
328 __u32 count_props;
329 __u32 obj_id;
330 __u32 obj_type;
331};
332
333struct drm_mode_obj_set_property {
334 __u64 value;
335 __u32 prop_id;
336 __u32 obj_id;
337 __u32 obj_type;
338};
339
340struct drm_mode_get_blob {
341 __u32 blob_id;
342 __u32 length;
343 __u64 data;
344};
345
346struct drm_mode_fb_cmd {
347 __u32 fb_id;
348 __u32 width;
349 __u32 height;
350 __u32 pitch;
351 __u32 bpp;
352 __u32 depth;
353 /* driver specific handle */
354 __u32 handle;
355};
356
357#define DRM_MODE_FB_INTERLACED (1<<0) /* for interlaced framebuffers */
358#define DRM_MODE_FB_MODIFIERS (1<<1) /* enables ->modifer[] */
359
360struct drm_mode_fb_cmd2 {
361 __u32 fb_id;
362 __u32 width;
363 __u32 height;
364 __u32 pixel_format; /* fourcc code from drm_fourcc.h */
365 __u32 flags; /* see above flags */
366
367 /*
368 * In case of planar formats, this ioctl allows up to 4
369 * buffer objects with offsets and pitches per plane.
370 * The pitch and offset order is dictated by the fourcc,
371 * e.g. NV12 (http://fourcc.org/yuv.php#NV12) is described as:
372 *
373 * YUV 4:2:0 image with a plane of 8 bit Y samples
374 * followed by an interleaved U/V plane containing
375 * 8 bit 2x2 subsampled colour difference samples.
376 *
377 * So it would consist of Y as offsets[0] and UV as
378 * offsets[1]. Note that offsets[0] will generally
379 * be 0 (but this is not required).
380 *
381 * To accommodate tiled, compressed, etc formats, a per-plane
382 * modifier can be specified. The default value of zero
383 * indicates "native" format as specified by the fourcc.
384 * Vendor specific modifier token. This allows, for example,
385 * different tiling/swizzling pattern on different planes.
386 * See discussion above of DRM_FORMAT_MOD_xxx.
387 */
388 __u32 handles[4];
389 __u32 pitches[4]; /* pitch for each plane */
390 __u32 offsets[4]; /* offset of each plane */
391 __u64 modifier[4]; /* ie, tiling, compressed (per plane) */
392};
393
394#define DRM_MODE_FB_DIRTY_ANNOTATE_COPY 0x01
395#define DRM_MODE_FB_DIRTY_ANNOTATE_FILL 0x02
396#define DRM_MODE_FB_DIRTY_FLAGS 0x03
397
398#define DRM_MODE_FB_DIRTY_MAX_CLIPS 256
399
400/*
401 * Mark a region of a framebuffer as dirty.
402 *
403 * Some hardware does not automatically update display contents
404 * as a hardware or software draw to a framebuffer. This ioctl
405 * allows userspace to tell the kernel and the hardware what
406 * regions of the framebuffer have changed.
407 *
408 * The kernel or hardware is free to update more than just the
409 * region specified by the clip rects. The kernel or hardware
410 * may also delay and/or coalesce several calls to dirty into a
411 * single update.
412 *
413 * Userspace may annotate the updates, the annotates are a
414 * promise made by the caller that the change is either a copy
415 * of pixels or a fill of a single color in the region specified.
416 *
417 * If the DRM_MODE_FB_DIRTY_ANNOTATE_COPY flag is given then
418 * the number of updated regions are half of num_clips given,
419 * where the clip rects are paired in src and dst. The width and
420 * height of each one of the pairs must match.
421 *
422 * If the DRM_MODE_FB_DIRTY_ANNOTATE_FILL flag is given the caller
423 * promises that the region specified of the clip rects is filled
424 * completely with a single color as given in the color argument.
425 */
426
427struct drm_mode_fb_dirty_cmd {
428 __u32 fb_id;
429 __u32 flags;
430 __u32 color;
431 __u32 num_clips;
432 __u64 clips_ptr;
433};
434
435struct drm_mode_mode_cmd {
436 __u32 connector_id;
437 struct drm_mode_modeinfo mode;
438};
439
440#define DRM_MODE_CURSOR_BO 0x01
441#define DRM_MODE_CURSOR_MOVE 0x02
442#define DRM_MODE_CURSOR_FLAGS 0x03
443
444/*
445 * depending on the value in flags different members are used.
446 *
447 * CURSOR_BO uses
448 * crtc_id
449 * width
450 * height
451 * handle - if 0 turns the cursor off
452 *
453 * CURSOR_MOVE uses
454 * crtc_id
455 * x
456 * y
457 */
458struct drm_mode_cursor {
459 __u32 flags;
460 __u32 crtc_id;
461 __s32 x;
462 __s32 y;
463 __u32 width;
464 __u32 height;
465 /* driver specific handle */
466 __u32 handle;
467};
468
469struct drm_mode_cursor2 {
470 __u32 flags;
471 __u32 crtc_id;
472 __s32 x;
473 __s32 y;
474 __u32 width;
475 __u32 height;
476 /* driver specific handle */
477 __u32 handle;
478 __s32 hot_x;
479 __s32 hot_y;
480};
481
482struct drm_mode_crtc_lut {
483 __u32 crtc_id;
484 __u32 gamma_size;
485
486 /* pointers to arrays */
487 __u64 red;
488 __u64 green;
489 __u64 blue;
490};
491
492#define DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_EVENT 0x01
493#define DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_ASYNC 0x02
494#define DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_FLAGS (DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_EVENT|DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_ASYNC)
495
496/*
497 * Request a page flip on the specified crtc.
498 *
499 * This ioctl will ask KMS to schedule a page flip for the specified
500 * crtc. Once any pending rendering targeting the specified fb (as of
501 * ioctl time) has completed, the crtc will be reprogrammed to display
502 * that fb after the next vertical refresh. The ioctl returns
503 * immediately, but subsequent rendering to the current fb will block
504 * in the execbuffer ioctl until the page flip happens. If a page
505 * flip is already pending as the ioctl is called, EBUSY will be
506 * returned.
507 *
508 * Flag DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_EVENT requests that drm sends back a vblank
509 * event (see drm.h: struct drm_event_vblank) when the page flip is
510 * done. The user_data field passed in with this ioctl will be
511 * returned as the user_data field in the vblank event struct.
512 *
513 * Flag DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_ASYNC requests that the flip happen
514 * 'as soon as possible', meaning that it not delay waiting for vblank.
515 * This may cause tearing on the screen.
516 *
517 * The reserved field must be zero until we figure out something
518 * clever to use it for.
519 */
520
521struct drm_mode_crtc_page_flip {
522 __u32 crtc_id;
523 __u32 fb_id;
524 __u32 flags;
525 __u32 reserved;
526 __u64 user_data;
527};
528
529/* create a dumb scanout buffer */
530struct drm_mode_create_dumb {
531 uint32_t height;
532 uint32_t width;
533 uint32_t bpp;
534 uint32_t flags;
535 /* handle, pitch, size will be returned */
536 uint32_t handle;
537 uint32_t pitch;
538 uint64_t size;
539};
540
541/* set up for mmap of a dumb scanout buffer */
542struct drm_mode_map_dumb {
543 /** Handle for the object being mapped. */
544 __u32 handle;
545 __u32 pad;
546 /**
547 * Fake offset to use for subsequent mmap call
548 *
549 * This is a fixed-size type for 32/64 compatibility.
550 */
551 __u64 offset;
552};
553
554struct drm_mode_destroy_dumb {
555 uint32_t handle;
556};
557
558/* page-flip flags are valid, plus: */
559#define DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_TEST_ONLY 0x0100
560#define DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_NONBLOCK 0x0200
561#define DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_ALLOW_MODESET 0x0400
562
563#define DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_FLAGS (\
564 DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_EVENT |\
565 DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_ASYNC |\
566 DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_TEST_ONLY |\
567 DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_NONBLOCK |\
568 DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_ALLOW_MODESET)
569
570struct drm_mode_atomic {
571 __u32 flags;
572 __u32 count_objs;
573 __u64 objs_ptr;
574 __u64 count_props_ptr;
575 __u64 props_ptr;
576 __u64 prop_values_ptr;
577 __u64 reserved;
578 __u64 user_data;
579};
580
581/**
582 * Create a new 'blob' data property, copying length bytes from data pointer,
583 * and returning new blob ID.
584 */
585struct drm_mode_create_blob {
586 /** Pointer to data to copy. */
587 __u64 data;
588 /** Length of data to copy. */
589 __u32 length;
590 /** Return: new property ID. */
591 __u32 blob_id;
592};
593
594/**
595 * Destroy a user-created blob property.
596 */
597struct drm_mode_destroy_blob {
598 __u32 blob_id;
599};
600
601#endif
